question: Tank you veddy much.

question: No. Caspiar.

question: It's a veddy small island in de Caspian Sea. It sunk.

question: You see, I want to be the biggest star in the world.
answer: People love... comedians.

question: I'm not a comedian. I have no talent. I'm a song-and-dance man.

question: See, I don't want easy laughs.
answer: You're insane. But -- you might also be brilliant. Alright, Andy... let's do it. Sammy, opening for David Brenner is a fine gig. You'll be on the road... get some exposure... Who? Oh. Sammy, think about it. I gotta go. Hello? George Shapiro here.

question: You're insane. But -- you might also be brilliant. Alright, Andy... let's do it. Sammy, opening for David Brenner is a fine gig. You'll be on the road... get some exposure... Who? Oh. Sammy, think about it. I gotta go. Hello? George Shapiro here.

answer: "Speaking"! Reeking, seeking, creaking... Freaking!

question: Can I help you with something?

question: Who is this?
answer: You -- you know damn straight who it is. Tony Clifton! A name to respect. A name to fear. Beer. Gear. Deer. Ear.

question: Look... I don't know what your problem is...

question: Do any thoughts come...? Good...

question: You always had a good heart. But I'm proud of the progress you've made in your discipline.
answer: Yes. TM got me focused. In fact, my manager got me a TV gig! It's just some new show with no budget, but I'm still excited.

question: Are you at peace with your family?
answer: Um, yes. I haven't fought with them, since I started here.

question: Goals are important.
answer: I stopped drinking. I gave up drugs. And I'm meditating three hours a day. It's the center of my life...

question: We are all impressed.

question: And this is a CLASS ACT! It's the guys who did the Mary Tyler Moore and Bob Newhart shows! It takes place in a taxi stand! And you're gonna be the Fonzie!

question: NO! The Fonzie! The crazy breakout character! The guy that all the kids impersonate and put on their lunchboxes!

question: "No"? "No" to which part??

question: You have to do it.

answer: Writing down my terms.

question: Are you makin' fun of me --? This is RIDICULOUS!

question: Mr. Kaufman will only appear in half the episodes. Mr. Kaufman requires an undisturbed 90 minutes of meditation prior to filming. Mr. Kaufman won't rehearse. Mr. Kaufman gets his own network Special. Tony Clifton. I don't know. Andy?

question: Eh, hi, Andy. Look, this Tony Clifton... is he performing anywhere?

question: And YOU. I wanna see you backstage!

question: Andy... uhh... this network has a long-standing policy
answer: But it's only for thirty seconds!

question: Mr. Shapiro, this is Gene Knight, up at Harrah's Tahoe. We'd like to book Andy Kaufman for our showroom.
answer: Ehh -- Andy doesn't really like playing casinos. The audiences don't work well for him.

question: Oh.

question: Eh, sure. We're trying to expand our audience base -- and I know the college kids really love Andy Kaufman.
answer: Look -- I gotta be clear with you. Tony Clifton is NOT Andy Kaufman.

question: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I know! Wink wink! Nudge nudge!

question: I'll take my chances!!
answer: Fine, be my guest! Book him. Gene, you misunderstood!! You're not getting BOTH of them! It's physically impossible!

question: Why's that? You said over and over and over, Tony Clifton is not Andy Kaufman --
answer: Yeah, I KNOW what I said! But -- trust me, it's not gonna happen!

question: You're so proud. You're like some retarded kid comin' home from school
answer: But wasn't it funny?

question: "Funny"? I dunno. But "intriguing"... "mindboggling"... perhaps "headache-inducing"... sure. Like, that moment, when you both came onstage...
answer: Uh-huh! See, with all these articles, people think they're insiders. They see Tony Clifton, and they say, "Ah, that's really Andy Kaufman." But that spoils it. So NOW, Tony denying being me is the truth! Tony's not me! But maybe he is! The audience will never know... They'll think they're laughin' at me -- but actually I'll be laughin' at them, because they're wrong and I'm right!

question: No, I'm sure we'll be fine. Popcorn?

question: I really want one. One large tub of popcorn, please, extra butter.

question: Hey, I love movie theater popcorn... but that doesn't mean I have to sit through "On Golden Pond."
answer: Fine. Why did you call me? The last person I ever expected to get a call from was you.

question: Gosh. Gee, Lynne... I was just so impressed with your wrestling moves. Hi...

question: No, I'm sure we'll be fine. Popcorn?

question: I really want one. One large tub of popcorn, please, extra butter.

question: Hey, I love movie theater popcorn... but that doesn't mean I have to sit through "On Golden Pond."

question: Gosh. Gee, Lynne... I was just so impressed with your wrestling moves.

question: Do you wanna to go to Memphis and get married?

question: Yes.

question: (he SPEAKS VERY

question: T-that's not true --

question: Thanks for seeing me on such short notice. I... I wanted to talk to you about booking Andy on "Saturday Night Live."
answer: George -- I don't know if Andy works for our show anymore. That wrestling stuff... is such a turnoff.

question: We agree completely. Andy has to reconnect with his core audience. So I got him on Letterman tonight. He's gonna apologize to Jerry Lawler, then repent for all his bad guy shenanigans.
answer: That's smart.

question: He's very sincere. And he needs your show...
answer: Okay. It'd be good to have the old Andy back.

question: I apologize for all the wrestling I've ever done. I'm sorry for all the abuse I've ever given... I was just playing bad guy wrestler. That's not me... it's just a role. But Jerry took it personally.
answer: He thinks everything's a joke -- but it's not. Did you laugh when you were layin' in the hospital??

question: My father said I should've gotten a lawyer --!

question: And you're just poor white trash!

question: T-there wasn't a reason to purposely hurt me --

question: My father said I should've gotten a lawyer --!

answer: And this wasn't "Merv." This was the hippest audience on television. They've turned on you.

Next time I'm in Memphis, I'll stop by the house, and Noreen can make me her double chocolate cake. Maybe I can turn it into a bit. I can go back on the show, and say it was rigged. question: Open your eyes... close your eyes... open your eyes... close your eyes... open your eyes... close your eyes...
answer: Excuse me, Andy...

question: Yes, your Holiness?

question: Why?? I... I attend every year.

answer: The wrestling... the sexist remarks... the foul language... these things are not becoming of an enlightened individual. It seems you have no respect for anything.

question: Go away.

question: ... but one ting I do not like is too much traffic. Tonight I had to come on de freeway, and it was so much traffic... It took me an hour and a half to get here! T-take my wife, please take her... H-her cooking... Uh, cooking is so bad, is terrible.

question: Sir, do you have a problem?
answer: Yeah, my problem is you're tired.

question: I, I was asked to do this material -
answer: Sure, because your new stuff's a bunch of crap. Kaufman, people are sick of you. The wrestling... the hoaxes...

question: Hey -- that stuff gets written-up in the papers --
answer: Who gives a shit?! It's not funny!

question: I -- I got some freaky rare kind. It's called large-celled carcinoma.
answer: Jesus, Andy! Can they cure it?

question: They don't know... they've gotta run more tests.
answer: Have you told your family?

question: How can you be so casual??!
answer: Even if I'm dying -- I still need clean socks.

question: You're NOT DYING!
answer: Okay. You're probably right.

question: God, you're so detached!!

question: What a crock.
answer: How dare you make light of this!

question: Dad, I cried when he broke his neck. He's not gettin' me again --
answer: Jesus! He's got lung cancer!

question: Mom, it's Cedars-Sinai! It's a showbiz hospital! Andy's studio friends probably run this place!
answer: He plans these things out. He takes over, hires actors... Personally, I didn't think that "doctor" was very convincing.

question: Did you notice his costume had the wrong shoes?
answer: Yeah! He didn't have doctor shoes!

question: I see them... I see the white cells...
answer: What was that all about?

question: It's visualization therapy. He's helping me turn inward and fight the disease.
answer: He's an actor. I remember him in "The In-Laws."

question: Uh, yes... that's true. But he's also ordained in holistic medicine.
answer: You must take a little pleasure in it.

question: Of course! But that doesn't mean I don't need everyone's support! I can't be surrounded by negative energy.
answer: Andy, you're surrounded by what you create. You are the KING of negative energy.

question: Y-yeah? Well, then it has to stop! Because if these bad vibes get out... then everyone will be talkin' about how sick I am, and it becomes a self-fulfilling prophecy, and then -- I'm dead.
answer: So how can I help you...?

question: I wanna go back to work and put on a happy show. The best show anybody's ever seen!

question: No clubs. I wanna reach the TOP! Carnegie Hall...! This is great. The crowd's gonna love this! Hey... do you still think any of those cowgirls are still alive?
answer: I dunno. If they were, they'd be pushin' 80.

question: Well, call SAG. It'd be cool to get one on the show. I want the evening to build and build. It's gonna have the most incredible ending
answer: And you say, "Santa, what am I gettin' for Christmas?" And he says, "Cancer!"

question: No! NO NO NO! None of that! I want this show to be positive!
answer: That's great... but this show's gonna cost a fortune. Even if it sells out, you'll still lose eighty grand.

question: I don't care about the money. I just want the show to deliver.
answer: So who's gonna pay for it?

question: Tony Clifton.
answer: You know Tony doesn't have that kind of money.

question: Then he'll borrow it. I know Tony better than you do. Even if he has to work another ten years to pay it off, he'll do it!
answer: Okay, Andy. Will do.

question: Abbu daba, abi abbu daba! Abbu daba, abu dabu do! Abbu dabbu da ba do...! A ba du ba ti la ma na go! Abbu da ba du ba ti lama na gobo abi tabu la! Ladies and Gentlemen! I'm pleased to announce that we have with us the one surviving cowgirl from that 1931 film, Eleanor "Cody" Gould!! Well, it's gettin' even better! 'Cause we found one of the original hobby horses! Do you -- do you think you could treat us to a few steps from "Jingle Jangle Jingle"?
answer: Is there a doctor in the house??!

question: Ladies and Gentlemen, she's alive! Ladies and Gentlemen, the Mormon Tabernacle Choir!!! Single file! Don't rush! There's enough cookies for everyone!! I don't want this to ever end... Okay. Let's try two of those... and one of the pink ones.
answer: I know... The cancer's terminal. Look, personally, I think rubbing rocks on people is a load of horseshit. But if it makes Andy happy, that's all that matters.

question: It's all macrobiotic. Millet, burdock root, kelp... Andy says it'll purify him.
answer: What is that crap? Looks like somethin' my dog would puke up!! How 'bout me and you dolls go get some REAL food

question: ...Andy...?
answer: I ain't Andy! I'm Tony! Andy's sick -- pick, chick, kick, lick! The doctor says he's a goner. But Tony's built like a mule! Andy asked me to be his pallbearer! I'll do it for him! I'm getting stronger and stronger! Here, watch this!

question: Stop it! C'mon, put that down.
answer: Yeah, you're right. We better get movin'. We don't wanna miss Happy Hour at Kelbos -- all the Mai Tai's you can drink for $4.99. Dammit...

question: I can't move my arm.
answer: You've got good days and bad days.

question: My hair is coming out.
answer: Yeah...

question: I've got an idea for a new TV show for me to star in. It's called "Uncle Andy's Fun House" -- it'll be a Saturday morning thing where I can goof off with the kids. You know, puppets, magic tricks...
answer: I think we can sell that.

question: Hey... thanks for always backin' me.
answer: Did your -- doctor say it's okay for you to go back to work?

question: Ehhh, you know those guys. If he had his way, I'd be stuck in the hospital, running tests all day. And anyway, I've found a new guy who's gonna be able to instantly remove the cancer.
answer: Really?

question: Yeah! He's a psychic surgeon in the Philippines, and he's amazing! He rubs you and sucks the disease right out!
answer: The Philippines? I dunno... Andy... he sounds like one of your characters.

question: No... this guy's special. He performs miracles. Well... My show is over. I did my best, and I just want to say, until we meet again... please remember
answer: It's a perfect Kaufman audience.
